shortened_actionable_feedback:
Based on the feedback provided, here is some actionable feedback for the teacher and course designer:

1. Improve course structure: The issues with Panopto not functioning properly and demotivating students can be addressed by using a more well-known or functional platform in the future. Consider exploring other options such as YouTube Live, Zoom, or Google Meet for video conferencing.
2. Enhance technology support: Make sure that the technology used in the course is reliable and user-friendly. Provide clear instructions and support to students on how to use the platform and troubleshoot any issues that may arise.
3. Foster collaboration: Encourage students to work together and learn from each other by incorporating more group tasks and activities into the course. This can help build a sense of community and foster deeper understanding of the material.
4. Continuously improve teaching materials: Regularly review and update the teaching materials to ensure they are relevant, useful, and well-presented. Consider seeking feedback from students on what they find most helpful and what can be improved.
5. Build on strengths: The teacher's passion and expertise in the subject matter are clear strengths of the course. Continue to leverage these strengths by providing engaging and interactive learning experiences that build on these areas of excellence.
6. Address demotivation: Identify any other factors that may be contributing to student demotivation, such as lack of feedback or insufficient support, and address them accordingly. Provide regular feedback and support to students throughout the course to help them stay motivated and engaged.
Feedback_good: Forelæseren er dygtig og pationeret, og indholdet i forelæsningen er meget relevant for vores projekt. Forelæseren er også meget åben og velkommene.. Relevant og brugbart undervisningsmateriale og undervisner er god til at formidle indholdet.     Indholdet var meget fokuseret på participatory design frem for brugercentreret, hvilket var spændende men ikke så relevant for P3.. Enrique var velforberedt og god til formidle stoffet. Det blev undervist i et godt tempo med godt supplerende materiale.    Enrique er generelt relaterbar, hvilket gør, at man engagerer sig mere i stoffet.    Enrique tog sig tid til at forklare ting som nogle af eleverne fandt forvirrende, og sørgede for, at forklare det på en måde, så alle forstod det til sidst.    Øvelserne gav mulighed for at afprøve de underviste teorier og metoder i praksis.
Feedback_bad: Starten af kurset var lidt rodet da opgaver og forelæsning ikke spillede godt sammen og næsten alle studerende gik hjem da det kom til opgaverne. Selvvalgt grupper kunne være en løsning så dem der gad at lave opgaverne ville gå i gruppe sammen og rent faktisk lave opgaverne.. Panopto fungerer ikke og virker demotiverende for deltagelse i undervisningens opgaver.. Øvelserne kunne godt være grænseoverskridende for nogle.    Panopto fungerede ikke altid og var langsomt, og var svært at sætte op/arbejde med. I fremtiden ville det være bedre, hvis der kunne bruges en mere kendt eller velfungerende platform.

shortened_actionable_feedback:
Based on the feedback you provided, here is some actionable feedback for the lecturers:

1. Improve your pronunciation and enunciation: Many students found it difficult to understand what you were saying due to your mumbling and indistinct speech. Consider working with a vocal coach or practicing in front of a mirror to improve your pronunciation and enunciation.
2. Engage with the students: Instead of simply reading from your slides, make an effort to connect with the students and convey meaningful information. Use examples, ask questions, and encourage discussion to help students understand the material better.
3. Provide clear explanations: Make sure you are providing detailed and clear explanations of the concepts being taught. Avoid using technical jargon without proper explanation, as this can confuse students and make it difficult for them to keep up with the material.
4. Use visual aids: Incorporate more visual aids, such as diagrams, charts, and videos, into your lectures to help students understand complex concepts better. This can also help to break up the monotony of listening to you speak.
5. Provide additional resources: Consider providing additional resources, such as practice problems or study guides, to help students keep up with the material outside of class. This can help to bridge any knowledge gaps and ensure that all students are on the same page.
6. Seek feedback from students: Solicit feedback from students on what they found challenging in your lectures and how you could improve. This can help you identify areas for improvement and make changes to benefit all students.

By implementing these suggestions, you can improve your teaching skills and help your students better understand the material being taught. Remember, effective communication is key to successful learning, so be sure to prioritize this in your lectures.
Feedback_good: Forelæsningerne var gode, forelæserne var gode til at forklare deres emner.. Underviseren sprogkundskaber på engelsk er ikke eksisterende, det er svært at forstå, der bliver mumlet meget og det lader til de ikke har en grundlæggende forståelse for sproget. Dvs. de ikke har forståelse for de ord de bruger og dermed giver deres undervisning ingen mening, de kunne lige så vel bare undervise på deres modermålsprog så ville vi forstå lige så meget. På samme tid lader det til at de bare læser direkte op fra slidesene, og endda som om det er første gang de kigger på dem når de står til undervisningen. Derfor står man tilbage med følelsen af at al kommunikationen bliver tabt mellem lærer og studerende, da de ikke forstår vores engelsk og de ikke selv kan kommunikere, samt at de ikke har forståelse for det materiale de underviser i.
Feedback_bad: bogens opgaver var ikke så gode, bogen var svær at finde rundt i.. Få nogle ordentlige undervisere. Det kan godt være man er dygtig faglig, men det er virkelig ikke ens betydende med at det går hånd i hånd med gode undervisningskundskaber!!

shortened_actionable_feedback:
Based on the feedback provided, here is some actionable feedback that could be given to the programming course:

1. Improve the quality of instruction: The course could benefit from more comprehensive and engaging lectures, as well as more interactive learning activities. This could involve incorporating real-world examples, group projects, and hands-on exercises to help students better understand and apply the concepts being taught.
2. Provide more supportive staff: The author mentions that they have difficulty getting help with assignments due to a lack of interaction with the instructor. To address this, the course could provide more opportunities for students to ask questions and receive feedback from staff members, such as office hours or dedicated support sessions.
3. Close the gap between expectations and understanding: The author notes that there is a significant gap between the course's expectations and their understanding of programming concepts. To address this, the course could provide more thorough introductions to key concepts, offer additional resources for further learning, and provide ongoing support to help students progress at an appropriate pace.
4. Offer more personalized feedback: The author expresses gratitude towards someone who taught them C# from scratch, highlighting the importance of personalized feedback and guidance. To provide more personalized feedback in the course, staff could use various assessment methods, such as peer review or self-assessment, to help students identify areas for improvement and track their progress over time.
5. Encourage collaboration: The author notes that they are not learning anything despite trying their best. To address this, the course could encourage more collaboration among students through group projects, discussions, and other interactive activities. This could help foster a sense of community and shared learning, as well as provide opportunities for students to learn from one another.

Overall, the key takeaways from the author's feedback are that the course needs to improve the quality of instruction, provide more supportive staff, close the gap between expectations and understanding, offer more personalized feedback, and encourage collaboration among students. By addressing these areas, the course could provide a more effective and engaging learning experience for its students.
Feedback_good: læsestoffet var godt, med gode links til ms doc. kode fremvisning fungerede godt.. Fuldstændig elendig, fuldstændig håbløs!!! forelæser..... Man lærer absolut intet, hun forstår aldrig når man spørger hende om noget - man bliver bare mødt af et "ok". Der bliver læst direkte op fra slides og det er en kamp at prøve og forstå hvad hun siger. C# i sig selv er så højt et niveau og der er et kæmpe spring i sværhedsgraden fra GPRO til GOOP at der desværre bliver tabt rigtig mange dygtige studerende. Når man så heller ikke kan få hjælp til øvelsesopgaverne fordi man ikke kan interagere med forelæseren, så føler man sig da først fuldstændig tabt og uden en chance for at komme igennem faget.

"Man kan kun komme til eksamen hvis ens program fungerer", selvom man godt kan have en god forståelse for programmering men bare lige har nogle små fejl.   Stort spring fra kursus i grundlæggende programmering fra første semester.. Er sikker på at Kaixuan er en rar og flink dame, som kun vil os det bedste - men giv os nu nogle undervisere som rent faktisk kan tale ordentlig engelsk, hvis det ikke skal være på dansk. Gerne en som kan lære fra sig og sætte sig på niveau med den studerende.

Explore alternative learning resources: If the course is not available, consider exploring other online learning resources, such as MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses), video tutorials, or online lectures. These can provide similar knowledge and skills without the need to access a specific course.
4. Set up a reminder system: Set up a reminder system to alert you when the course becomes available. This can be done through a calendar app or by subscribing to a course notification list.

shortened_actionable_feedback:
Based on the feedback provided, here are some actionable suggestions for improving the OOP course experience for the students:

1. Provide additional support for beginners: Since many of the students are not familiar with Java, consider offering additional support and resources to help them catch up. This could include extra practice problems, video tutorials, or even a separate beginner-friendly track within the course.
2. Slow down the pace of the course: The students feel overwhelmed by the fast pace of the course, so consider slowing it down to give them more time to absorb the material and keep up with the expectations. This could involve breaking down complex concepts into smaller, more manageable pieces or providing more time for hands-on practice.
3. Emphasize problem-solving skills: While the students struggle with the technical aspects of the course, they also express frustration with being asked to switch from Python to Java. To address this, consider placing more emphasis on problem-solving skills and how they can be applied across different programming languages. This could involve providing more practical exercises and projects that demonstrate how the concepts learned in the course can be applied in real-world scenarios.
4. Encourage collaboration: The students feel disadvantaged compared to their peers from COMTEK, so consider encouraging collaboration among all students. This could involve creating opportunities for students to work together on projects or providing a shared space for them to ask questions and get help from one another.
5. Provide more feedback and support: The students feel that they are not getting enough feedback and support from the instructor, so consider stepping up your game in this area. This could involve providing more detailed feedback on their assignments, offering office hours or drop-in sessions for Q&A, or simply being more available to answer questions and provide guidance as needed.
6. Consider a different teaching method: The students express frustration with the course's emphasis on networking and multi-threading, which they find challenging. To address this, consider experimenting with different teaching methods or incorporating more interactive elements into the course to help students better understand these concepts. For example, you could use simulations, visual aids, or group activities to help students grasp these complex topics.

By implementing these suggestions, you can help improve the OOP course experience for the students and ensure that they are able to keep up with the demands of the course while also feeling supported and motivated throughout their learning journey.
Feedback_good: God underviser, altid til rådighed  - OOADI-miniprojekt bringer vores kompetencer i spil og tester anvendeligheden af teorien.. Undervisers engagement, og hans villighed til at afsætte ekstra tid til hjælp i forbindelse med eksamensprojekt. Vores punkter til, hvad der fungerede mindre godt, har udelukkende været baseret på kurset selv.
Feedback_bad: Vi havde ikke forudsætningerne til at programmere i Java, hvilket gav mange udfordringer ifm. især opgaveregning.   - Vi fornemmede, at COMTEK var langt bedre rustet til at deltage i kurset.. Hele kurset har været meget uoverkommeligt på grund af, at der var en forventning om, at vi havde skrevet i et lav-niveau-programmeringssprog tidligere. Idet vi kun havde skrevet i R og Python før, var det utroligt svært at indhente den viden omkring Java, som kurset forudsatte at vi havde. Især når vi sammenlignede vores færdigheder med dem, som COMTEK havde i begyndelse af kurset, var det klart, at vi manglede nogle færdigheder.    At gå fra at skrive simple funktioner i Python til at skulle lave multi-threading og networking i Java, samtidig med at lære principperne bag objektorienteret programmering, på tre måneder har været en enormt stor opgave.    Desuden har det været svært for flere af os at se, hvordan nogle af emnerne, især treading og networking, er relevante for vores studie. Det kunne føles som om, at kurset er skræddersyet til vores medstuderende på COMTEK, og at vi så lige er røget med ind i svinget.
Feedback_extra: Vi forstår ikke, at vi ikke måtte programmere i Python, da vi var meget bedre rustet til dette.
